title: Oracle VirtualBox VRDP Integer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Oracle VirtualBox. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of USB Request Block messages. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in an integer overflow before writing to memory. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the RDP service.
addtionnal_details: Oracle has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2022.html
timeline:
2022-09-06 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-10-21 - Coordinated public release of advisory
